results.title: Atmosphere and its circulation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the nature of air, showing its structure, chemical composition, weight and distribution. Its circulation in relation to the Earth, how circulation forms pressure bands and is affected by rotation of the Earth, causing movement or winds; the structure and dynamics of atmosphere are studied with the aid of animated diagrams. No other credits available.

results.title: Atlantic link
results.creator_credit: Jack Greenwood and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. Describes the routing of landlines on both sides of the Atlantic; the drama and precision involved in the laying of cables between Britain and Newfoundland.

results.title: The Athletes (Italian version)
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain. Narration is in the Italian language.

results.title: Athlete: hurdles
results.creator_credit: John Rickword, John Dobson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Members of the Great Britain Olympic Squad of 1972 demonstrate the techniques of hurdling, then young athletes practise these techniques. Illustrates the analysis and correction of common faults.

results.title: Ataturk: father of modern Turkey
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Explains how, at the end of World War I, Mustapha Kemal Ataturk took over government and began to Westernise the country. Discusses the various projects he started.

results.title: At your service
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the process of the manufacture of ball bearings by the famous Swedish firm of S.K.F. The firm has its own mines and steel works and carries the manufacturing processes right through to the finished product. For commercial uses some 8,000 different types and sizes are produced, in addition special precision ball bearings with an accuracy to 1,000,000 in. are produced for use in precision instruments.

results.title: Cylinders (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Designed to help children become aware of the creative possibilities of the cylindrical shape. Using readily available materials found in the home, children create an assortment of play things, models, sculptures and screens.

results.title: Boxes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows a number of things that can be made by children from boxes which originally held house-hold items. Cereal boxes covered with paper and coloured become a model village; milk cartons are made into cars or trains or animals. The biggest cartons, such as those in which refrigerators are delivered, appear as a truck, with two boys as the motive power, delivering to a playhouse. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543
results.creator_credit: Herbert E. Meyer, Walter Leckebusch and Filmstudio Walter Leckebusch
results.brief_description: Deals with aspects of the Renaissance and concentrates on the development of Holbein’s painting, drawing and etching. Holbein, a court painter, and a prime example of the new breed of man who could move out of the restrictive boundaries of his homeland to achieve fame and wealth in foreign courts and cities.
